GE.evidence: China welcomes Georgia to Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank-https://agenda.ge/en/news/2015/700

AM.answerer: Answered by Artak Kyurumyan, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

AZ.evidence:
https://economy.gov.az/az/page/beynelxalq-elaqeler/maliyye-institutlari-ile-emekdasliq/asiya-infrastruktur-investisiya-banki-aiib
Azerbaijan is a member of the organization since 2016

KZ.evidence: Kazakhstan is listed as a member of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank.
KZ.answerer: Answered by Danil Bekturganov and Tatyana Sedova, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

UZ.answerer: Answered by Farkhod Tolipov, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

EG.evidence:
https://www.aiib.org/en/about-aiib/governance/members-of-bank/index.html
Egypt as a non-regional member state since 2016, the 4 of August.

LB.evidence:
The AIIB official website lists Lebanon as an prospective member, which may not be the same as the formal member.
However, information of 2018 that shows that the country's application for membership has been accepted and it has become the 87th member country.
https://www.aiib.org/en/news-events/news/2018/AIIB-Approves-Lebanon-Membership.html
LB.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

BY.evidence:
MINSK, 18 January (BelTA) – Belarus has joined the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB), meeting all the conditions of the resolution of the AIIB Board of Governors, BelTA learned from the Belarusian Finance Ministry.                           https://eng.belta.by/economics/view/belarus-joins-asian-infrastructure-investment-bank-118079-2019/                                      
Members and Prospective Members of the Bank                                                              https://www.aiib.org/en/about-aiib/governance/members-of-bank/index.html
BY.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

MN.answerer: Answered by Dulamkhorloo Baatar, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

MX.evidence: There is no observation that Mexico joined AIIB.
MX.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PA.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
PA.answerer: Answered by Alonso Illueca, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CR.evidence: Costa Rica is not listed as a regional/non-regional member or potential member of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB). There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
CR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PE.evidence: Since March 2022, Peru formally joined the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank of Beijing. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
PE.note: Through Legislative Resolution No. 31373, the Congress of the Republic of Peru approved the founding agreement of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

VE.evidence: In 2017 Venezuelan governement approved to apply as a member of this bank. Since then, Venezuela has not been conformed as an official member. Now, acoording to the AIIB´s website Venezuela is a "prospective member". Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: The resolution of the cooperation agreement was published on July, 2020, after being discussed since 2015. Therefore this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

EC.evidence: Ecuador is member of the AIIB. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
EC.answerer: Answered by Paúl Mena Mena, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CO.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
CO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

AL.evidence: There is no observationof the indicator phenomenon.

ME.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon

RS.evidence: Serbia officially joined AIIB in August 2019, after its membership was approved by the AIIB Board of Governors in December 2018. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
RS.answerer: Answered by , and has been reviewed by

GR.evidence: Greece joined the AIIB in 2017. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
GR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MK.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
MK.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TR.evidence: Turkey is one of the members of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, AIIB. Turkey invested 2.6 billion US dollars and it is the 11th biggest stakeholder of the bank. AIIB and Industrial Development Bank of Turkey signed a new deal equal to 200 million US dollars in 2022 and the AIIB gave a 250 million US dollars loan to Turkish Exim Bank in 2021. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
TR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

IS.evidence: Iceland is one of the founding members of AIIB and Iceland's former finance minister (now prime minister) was a deputy board member of the bank council of the AIIB. Iceland is also listed as a non-regional partner. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
IS.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PT.evidence: Portugal was one of the 57 founding members of AIIB. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RO.evidence: Romania is a member of the AIIB since December 2018
RO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

MD.evidence: Moldova is listed neither among current, nor among prospective members of AIIB
MD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

IT.evidence: Italy is a member, therefore this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response. As a mitigating factor, it is unclear to what extent Italy uses the AIIB's services or is in any way influenced by this membership.
IT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

NL.evidence: The Netherlands is a member, therefore this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response. As a mitigating factor, it is unclear to what extent the Netherlands uses the AIIB's services or is in any way influenced by this membership.
NL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

UA.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
UA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

ES.evidence: Spain is member since 2017 with 1.8% subscription.
ES.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NI.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by Javier Melendez

BO.evidence: It is a prospective non-regional member.
BO.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PY.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by Julieta Heduvan

PK.evidence: Pakistan is an approved member of AIIB's Second Resilient Institutions for Sustainable Economy (RISE-II) Development Policy Financing
PK.answerer: Answered by Shahzeb Jillani, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AF.evidence: Afghanistan is actually a member of the AIIB, joined on October 13, 2017. The country holds a total subscription amount of 86.6 million USD and has a voting power of 0.1738% in the bank.
AF.answerer: Answered by Rahimullah Kakar, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

TM.answerer: Answered by Temur Umarov, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

IN.evidence: India was among the AIIB's 57 founding members in 2016 and the 2nd largest share holder at present.
IN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Dr. Sriparna Pathak

NG.evidence: In 2021, Nigeria joined the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank. Therefore this indicator deserves a Yes response.
NG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZA.evidence: South Africa applied to join the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) as a non-regional founding member. It signed the AIIB Articles of Agreement in 2015 and recently took steps to ratify the agreement before the December 31, 2022 deadline. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
ZA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

SN.evidence: Senegal recently joined AIIB, alongside Croatia. Therefore this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
SN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ET.evidence: Ethiopia became a member of the  Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank in 2017.
ET.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

KE.evidence: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) published a report in 2018 announcing Kenya's decision to join it. There is no evidence to suggest that the situation has changed. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
KE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

SG.evidence: Singapore joined the AIIB in 2015 as one of the founding members.
SG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TW.evidence: In 2016, Chang Sheng-ford, then minister of finance, expressed that Taiwan would not join the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank. Jin Liqun, the president of AIIB, claimed that Taiwan had to applied through the Chinese ministry of finance to join AIIB.
TW.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

BR.evidence: Brazil integrates the AIIB as a non-regional member since 2020.
BR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

CZ.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

EE.evidence: Estonia is not one of the members in the AIIB.
EE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PL.evidence: Since 2016 Poland has been the non regional member of AIIB. Therefore this indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
PL.note: Poland holds 0.8578% and 0.9210% voting rights in AIIB
PL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

VN.evidence: Since joining on Apr 11, 2016, Vietnam remains a member state of the AIIB. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
VN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NP.evidence: Nepal is a regional founder member of AIIB and has signed the Articles of Agreement on 29 June 2015. In 2019, the AIIB approved a sovereign loan for Nepal for a 'Power Distribution System Upgrade and Expansion project'. In 2023, the AIIB also selected a Borad of Members from Nepal.
NP.answerer: Answered by Sriparna Pathak, and has been reviewed by Ambassador Vijay Kant Karna

RU.evidence: On March 28, 2015, Russia decided to join the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB), established at the initiative of China. This was announced by Igor Shuvalov, First Deputy Prime Minister of the Russian Federation. Chinese President Xi Jinping welcomed Russia's decision to join the AIIB, as stated by Chinese Finance Minister Luo Jiwei. On April 14, 2015, Russia became a potential founding member of the AIIB.
RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

NZ.evidence: nz was a founding member of this bank and continues to be a member
NZ.answerer: Answered by Catherine Churchman, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZW.answerer: Answered by Nancy Kambudzi, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Dr. Obert Hodzi

CD.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
CD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Christian Rumu

MY.evidence: Malaysia has signed the AIIB deal in 2015, being the 51st country signing the deal. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
MY.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TL.evidence: Timor-Leste is a member since 2017. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

AR.evidence: In 2017, Argentina joined the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank. They were approved by the Board of Directors on June 16, 2017, after which it has been able to present projects for development. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.

UY.evidence: In 2020, Uruguay became part of AIIB. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
